title: Clinical All Blacks thrash toothless Ireland in RWC QF
text:
Cape Town - The defending champion All Blacks were far too strong for a toothless Ireland in Saturday's Rugby World Cup quarter-final in Tokyo, emerging as 46-14 winners.

The New Zealanders scored seven tries on the day and took a 22-0 lead into half-time as the sizeable Irish support in the crowd looked on helplessly.

By the time Robbie Henshaw crossed the whitewash for Ireland's first try of the game late in the second half, the match was already over as a contest.

It means that New Zealand will now meet England in next weekend's first semi-final in Yokohama after Eddie Jones' men beat Australia 40-16.

Scorers:

New Zealand 46 (22)

Tries: Aaron Smith (2), Beauden Barrett, Codie Taylor, Matt Todd, George Bridge, Jordie Barrett

Conversions: Richie Mo'unga (4)

Penalty: Mo'unga

Ireland 14 (0)

Tries: Robbie Henshaw, Penalty Try

Conversion: Joey Carbery

Teams:

New Zealand

15 Beauden Barrett, 14 Sevu Reece, 13 Jack Goodhue, 12 Anton Lienert-Brown, 11 George Bridge, 10 Richie Mo'unga, 9 Aaron Smith, 8 Kieran Read (captain), 7 Sam Cane, 6 Ardie Savea, 5 Sam Whitelock, 4 Brodie Retallick, 3 Nepo Laulala, 2 Codie Taylor, 1 Joe Moody

Substitutes: 16 Dane Coles, 17 Ofa Tuungafasi, 18 Angus Ta'avao, 19 Scott Barrett, 20 Matt Todd, 21 TJ Perenara, 22 Sonny Bill Williams, 23 Jordie Barrett

Ireland

15 Rob Kearney, 14 Keith Earls, 13 Garry Ringrose, 12 Robbie Henshaw, 11 Jacob Stockdale, 10 Johnny Sexton, 9 Conor Murray, 8 CJ Stander, 7 Josh van der Flier, 6 Peter O'Mahony, 5 James Ryan, 4 Iain Henderson, 3 Tadhg Furlong, 2 Rory Best (captain), 1 Cian Healy

Substitutes: 16 Niall Scannell, 17 Dave Kilcoyne, 18 Andrew Porter, 19 Tadgh Beirne, 20 Rhys Ruddock, 21 Joey Carbery, 22 Chris Farrell, 23 Jordan Larmour
description: The All Blacks were far too strong for Ireland in their Rugby World Cup quarter-final clash in Tokyo on Saturday.
